newsitem.title: USA: First Colorado to acquire Delta Federal.
newsitem.headline: First Colorado to acquire Delta Federal.

text.p: First Colorado Bancorp Inc of Lakewood, Colorado, said Wednesday it has signed a binding pact to merge Delta Federal Savings Bank FSB, Delta, Colorado, into its subsidiary, First Federal Bank of Colorado.
First Colorado said total assets to be acquired in the deal are about $39.1 million and total deposits to be acquired are about $30.6 million.
First Colorado said its subsidiary will buy 100 percent of Delta's outstanding stock, and each share of Delta common will be exchanged for First Colorado stock valued at $30.
Based on the price as of Wednesday, about 320,056 shares will be issued from treasury shares for the deal, First Colorado said.
First Colorado shares closed Wednesday up 1/4 at 17.
First Colorado said the deal will be accounted for as a purchase and will be tax-free to Delta shareholders.
It said the deal requires federal regulatory approval, Delta shareholder approval and completion of due diligence.
It said the deal should close in the fourth quarter.
